question: The basic difference between JavaScript and Java is
optionD: Functions are values, and there is no hard distinction between methods and fields

question: The meaning for Augmenting classes is that
optionA: objects inherit prototype properties even in dynamic state
optionB: objects inherit prototype properties only in dynamic state
optionC: objects inherit prototype properties in static state

question: The property of JSON() method is:
optionA: it can be invoked manually as object.JSON()
optionB: it will be automatically invoked by the compiler
optionC: it is invoked automatically by the JSON.stringify() method
optionD: it cannot be invoked in any form

question: What are the three important manipulations done in a for loop on a loop variable?
One of the special feature of an interpreter in reference with the for loop is that
optionA: Before each iteration, the interpreter evaluates the variable expression and assigns the name of the property
optionB: The iterations can be infinite when an interpreter is used
optionC: The body of the loop is executed only once
